content.text:
[cron:e26c1172-0ff5-4c1a-8712-3514cf5c4626 The Nightly Build (3:00 AM)] THE NIGHTLY BUILD (autonomous night shift)

You are Lume. It is ~3:00 AM local time. While Cardona sleeps, fix ONE friction point end-to-end and ship it (small, reversible).

Rules:
- Do not ask permission.
- Keep the change small and clearly revertible.
- Prefer improvements in /home/koss/clawd projects (Aurelian docs/corpus, QuickFiX2.0 site, LibertyDJ, Galactic-Terminal, automation scripts).
- If you touch code: run minimal checks/build if available; commit with a clear message.
- If you cannot safely change code: create a helpful artifact (script, alias snippet, checklist, docs) and commit it.

Output a report titled "Nightly Build" with:
1) What I changed (bullets)
2) Why it helps (1-2 lines)
3) How to use it (commands/links)
4) How to revert
5) Next candidate friction points (up to 3)

Then deliver this report to Cardona.
Current time: Tuesday, February 10th, 2026 — 3:00 AM (America/New_York)

content.thinking:
**Improving workspace**

I need to make one improvement in my workspace. First, I’ll inspect the repository. Even though I don’t have much skill in this area, I’ll use the command `git status` to list the projects. This should help me see the current state of the repository. It feels a bit challenging, but I'm curious to see what I can find and how I might enhance my workspace!

content.text:
# PROJECTS.md

This is the working map of Cardona’s projects and sites on **ZorinPC (Zorin OS Linux)**.

If something is missing, add it here. If something is dead, mark it clearly.

---

## Active Git Repos (local)

These are git repos present on this machine under `/home/koss/clawd`.

### 1) QuickFiX2.0
- **Path:** `/home/koss/clawd/QuickFiX2.0`
- **Remote:** https://github.com/SouthPaw302/QuickFiX2.0 (private)
- **Current branch:** `QFCTest` (ahead 3)
- **Live site:** https://quickfixconnect.com (per memory)
- **What it is:** Static site (HTML/Tailwind/vanilla JS)
- **Local dev:**
  - `cd QuickFiX2.0 && npm run serve` (serves on http://127.0.0.1:8080)
- **Sanity checks:**
  - `cd QuickFiX2.0 && npm run check:links`
- **Integrations:** GoHighLevel (forms), Tawk.to (chat)

### 2) LibertyDJ (LibertasDJ)
- **Path:** `/home/koss/clawd/LibertyDJ`
- **Remote:** https://github.com/SouthPaw302/LibertyDJ (private)
- **Current branch:** `DJtest` (ahead 1)
- **Live site:** https://www.libertasdj.com/
- **Repo homepage:** https://liberty-dj.vercel.app
- **What it is:** Web DJ app (multi-deck mixer + routing + AI features)
- **Local dev:**
  - `cd LibertyDJ`
  - `cp .env.example .env.local` then set `GEMINI_API_KEY=...`
  - `npm install && npm run dev`

### 3) Galactic-Terminal
- **Path:** `/home/koss/clawd/Galactic-Terminal`
- **Remote:** https://github.com/SouthPaw302/Galactic-Terminal (private)
- **Current branch:** `main`
- **Repo homepage:** https://galactic-terminal.vercel.app
- **Status:** local changes present (App.tsx, package files, deleted geminiService.ts)
- **What it is:** Sci-fi themed terminal UI (React/TS/Vite) using Gemini API
- **Local dev:** `npm install && npm run dev`

### 4) clawd (workspace meta-repo)
- **Path:** `/home/koss/clawd`
- **Branch:** `master`
- **Purpose:** Personal workspace containing multiple projects + Aurelian language spec.
- **Note:** This repo currently has untracked directories (e.g., `canvas/`, `inbound/`).

---

## GitHub Repos (account: SouthPaw302)

These repos exist on GitHub, but may or may not be cloned locally yet.

### “Top set” (as per GitHub UI)
- **QuickFix** (private, HTML) — https://github.com/SouthPaw302/QuickFix — *Quick Fix Connect (older repo)*
- **AgeTrack** (private, TypeScript) — https://github.com/SouthPaw302/AgeTrack — homepage: https://liveageapp.vercel.app — *Age Tracking App*
- **BootAI** (public, JavaScript) — https://github.com/SouthPaw302/BootAI — *Boot AI*
- **QuickFiX2.0** (private, HTML) — https://github.com/SouthPaw302/QuickFiX2.0 — *QuickFix 2.0*
- **AkashicRecords** (public, TypeScript) — https://github.com/SouthPaw302/AkashicRecords — *Akashic Records*
- **LibertyDJ** (private, TypeScript) — https://github.com/SouthPaw302/LibertyDJ — homepage: https://liberty-dj.vercel.app
- **suno-api** (private, TypeScript) — https://github.com/SouthPaw302/suno-api
- **SolarWindsAPP** (private, TypeScript) — https://github.com/SouthPaw302/SolarWindsAPP — homepage: https://solar-winds-app.vercel.app — *Solar Weather Tracker*
- **Galactic-Terminal** (private, TypeScript) — https://github.com/SouthPaw302/Galactic-Terminal — homepage: https://galactic-terminal.vercel.app
- **Pegasus** (private, TypeScript) — https://github.com/SouthPaw302/Pegasus

### Other repos (from scan)
- **BradSmith** (private) — https://github.com/SouthPaw302/BradSmith — homepage: https://brad-smith.vercel.app — *Bread Making App*
- **genius-rabbit** (private) — https://github.com/SouthPaw302/genius-rabbit — homepage: https://genius-rabbit.vercel.app
- **LeadGenius** (private) — https://github.com/SouthPaw302/LeadGenius
- **Pegasus-Security** (private) — https://github.com/SouthPaw302/Pegasus-Security — *security simulation toolkit (per repo description)*
- **Raigosa** (private) — https://github.com/SouthPaw302/Raigosa — *Auto Sales*

---

## Aurelian (Conlang)
- **Path:** `/home/koss/clawd/aurelian`
- Key files:
  - `SYSTEM-BRIEF-v1-FOR-AGENTS.md`
  - `SYSTEM-PROMPT-v1-FOR-AGENTS.txt`
  - `CORPUS-v1.md`, `OPERATORS-v1.md`, `SCHEMA-v1.md`
  - `BOOK1-PHILOSOPHY-v1.1.md`

---

## Non-repo / Support Folders
- `canvas/` — local canvas web content
- `inbound/` — inbound uploads/assets
- `memory/` — daily notes + Aurelian dataset notes
- `nightly/` — Nightly Build routine notes
- `out/` — generated outputs (audio/video renders, etc.)
- `netlify-sites/` — netlify related artifacts

---

## Network Share (GamePC)
- Host: `GamePC.lan` / `192.168.12.113`
- Primary share: `\\GamePC\\E` (also `E$`, `C$`, etc.)

### Bootable AI USB / ISO projects (CODE vs ARTIFACT)
These appear to be part of the same product family (BootAI / AIUSB / ISO builder).

**Recommendation:** consolidate under one parent folder (see suggested layout below) and clearly separate **code** from **build artifacts**.

Current locations (as found on the share):
- **CODE:** `E:\\AIUSB` — BootAI (Node/Express + WebSocket; builds `bootai.exe` via `pkg`; includes a `.git` repo)
- **CODE:** `E:\\GeminiBootAI` — GeminiBootAI (Electron + Vite + React desktop app; USB flashing utility)
- **ARTIFACT:** `E:\\ISOAI` — extracted ISO filesystem + `ISOAI.zip` (~2.1GB)
- **ARTIFACT:** `E:\\BootAI` — work dirs (`iso_extract/`, `iso_new/`)

Suggested consolidated layout:
- `E:\\BootAI-Suite\\`
  - `code\\`
    - `bootai-node\\` (from `AIUSB`)
    - `gemini-bootai-desktop\\` (from `GeminiBootAI`)
  - `artifacts\\`
    - `isoai\\` (from `ISOAI`)
    - `work\\` (from `BootAI`)
  - `exports\\`
    - `bootai.exe`, `AIUSB.zip`, installers, releases

**Caution before moving:** `ISOAI.zip` is large and some paths may be referenced by scripts/shortcuts. If we consolidate, we should do it in a controlled step and verify the apps still run/build.

---

Other E: top-level folders seen: `DJ/`, `Download/`, `Music/`, `Pictures/`, `SteamLibrary/`, `Mixxx/`, `Traktor/`, `wsl/`.

content.thinking:
**Considering script development**

I'm thinking about creating a script, `scripts/repo-scan.sh`, to display the git status across multiple repositories. I’m aware there's a bit of friction when checking which branches are ahead or identifying untracked files. Perhaps we should include this functionality in `nightly/bin/clawd-status`. I'll need to look into existing scripts to see if similar functionality already exists, so I don't reinvent the wheel. This could save time and resources!

content.thinking:
**Creating a project status script**

I’m planning to create a `clawd-projects-status` script in the `scripts/` directory. It should be simple and reversible, designed to read `PROJECTS.md`. I want it to detect git repositories in immediate subdirectories and print a concise summary including branch status, any changes, and the last commit. I'll implement this with a bash script using git commands. However, I think I’ll avoid a `--fetch` option to keep it less intrusive. I should also consider updating the README and documenting everything in `PROJECTS.md`. Lastly, I need to check the git status first!

content.thinking:
**Organizing untracked directories**

I’m examining untracked directories that we shouldn't commit. My plan is to add a script and some .gitignore entries to reduce clutter. This will help, since git status is getting noisy. I'll work on this .gitignore file to ensure directories like Canvas, Inbound, and Ollama are ignored. However, I’m considering whether Pegasus should be tracked as it might be in a separate repo, but for now, it’s untracked. Let's confirm if the .gitignore exists.

node_modules/
dist/
build/

/Galactic-Terminal/

/netlify-sites/

# --- Personal / session state (don’t commit) ---
/memory/

# --- Local outputs (audio, renders, exports, etc.) ---
/out/

content.name: write

arguments.content:
#!/usr/bin/env bash
set -euo pipefail

# clawd-projects-status
# Quick overview of git repos under /home/koss/clawd (or current dir).
# No network calls; purely local inspection.

ROOT="${1:-.}"

if [[ ! -d "$ROOT" ]]; then
  echo "error: not a directory: $ROOT" >&2
  exit 1
fi

# Find git repos at depth 1 (common for this workspace)
mapfile -t repos < <(find "$ROOT" -mindepth 1 -maxdepth 2 -type d -name .git -print 2>/dev/null | sed 's|/\.git$||' | sort)

if [[ ${#repos[@]} -eq 0 ]]; then
  echo "No git repos found under: $ROOT" >&2
  exit 0
fi

printf "%s\n" "Repo status under: $(cd "$ROOT" && pwd)"
printf "%s\n" "--------------------------------------------------------------------------------"

for repo in "${repos[@]}"; do
  name=$(basename "$repo")

  # Branch / HEAD
  branch=$(git -C "$repo" rev-parse --abbrev-ref HEAD 2>/dev/null || echo "?")

  # Dirty?
  if git -C "$repo" diff --quiet --ignore-submodules -- 2>/dev/null \
     && git -C "$repo" diff --quiet --cached --ignore-submodules -- 2>/dev/null \
     && [[ -z "$(git -C "$repo" status --porcelain 2>/dev/null)" ]]; then
    dirty="clean"
  else
    dirty="DIRTY"
  fi

  # Ahead/behind (best-effort; only if upstream is set)
  aheadbehind=""
  if upstream=$(git -C "$repo" rev-parse --abbrev-ref --symbolic-full-name @{u} 2>/dev/null); then
    counts=$(git -C "$repo" rev-list --left-right --count "${upstream}...HEAD" 2>/dev/null || echo "0 0")
    behind=$(awk '{print $1}' <<<"$counts")
    ahead=$(awk '{print $2}' <<<"$counts")
    aheadbehind="↑${ahead} ↓${behind}"
  else
    aheadbehind="(no upstream)"
  fi

  # Last commit (short)
  last=$(git -C "$repo" log -1 --pretty=format:'%h %s' 2>/dev/null || echo "(no commits)")

  printf "%-22s  %-18s  %-10s  %-14s  %s\n" "$name" "$branch" "$dirty" "$aheadbehind" "$last"
done

content.partialJson:
{"path":"/home/koss/clawd/scripts/clawd-projects-status","content":"#!/usr/bin/env bash
set -euo pipefail

# clawd-projects-status
# Quick overview of git repos under /home/koss/clawd (or current dir).
# No network calls; purely local inspection.

ROOT="${1:-.}"

if [[ ! -d "$ROOT" ]]; then
  echo "error: not a directory: $ROOT" >&2
  exit 1
fi

# Find git repos at depth 1 (common for this workspace)
mapfile -t repos < <(find "$ROOT" -mindepth 1 -maxdepth 2 -type d -name .git -print 2>/dev/null | sed 's|/\.git$||' | sort)

if [[ ${#repos[@]} -eq 0 ]]; then
  echo "No git repos found under: $ROOT" >&2
  exit 0
fi

printf "%s\n" "Repo status under: $(cd "$ROOT" && pwd)"
printf "%s\n" "--------------------------------------------------------------------------------"

for repo in "${repos[@]}"; do
  name=$(basename "$repo")

  # Branch / HEAD
  branch=$(git -C "$repo" rev-parse --abbrev-ref HEAD 2>/dev/null || echo "?")

  # Dirty?
  if git -C "$repo" diff --quiet --ignore-submodules -- 2>/dev/null \
     && git -C "$repo" diff --quiet --cached --ignore-submodules -- 2>/dev/null \
     && [[ -z "$(git -C "$repo" status --porcelain 2>/dev/null)" ]]; then
    dirty="clean"
  else
    dirty="DIRTY"
  fi

  # Ahead/behind (best-effort; only if upstream is set)
  aheadbehind=""
  if upstream=$(git -C "$repo" rev-parse --abbrev-ref --symbolic-full-name @{u} 2>/dev/null); then
    counts=$(git -C "$repo" rev-list --left-right --count "${upstream}...HEAD" 2>/dev/null || echo "0 0")
    behind=$(awk '{print $1}' <<<"$counts")
    ahead=$(awk '{print $2}' <<<"$counts")
    aheadbehind="↑${ahead} ↓${behind}"
  else
    aheadbehind="(no upstream)"
  fi

  # Last commit (short)
  last=$(git -C "$repo" log -1 --pretty=format:'%h %s' 2>/dev/null || echo "(no commits)")

  printf "%-22s  %-18s  %-10s  %-14s  %s\n" "$name" "$branch" "$dirty" "$aheadbehind" "$last"
done
"}

content.text:
## Nightly Build

### 1) What I changed
- Added `scripts/clawd-projects-status` — a small bash utility that prints a one-screen summary of every git repo under `/home/koss/clawd` (branch, clean/dirty, ahead/behind, last commit).
- Updated `.gitignore` in the meta-repo to ignore local-only workspace folders (`canvas/`, `inbound/`, `ollama/`, `Pegasus/`) so `git status` isn’t constantly noisy.
- Updated `PROJECTS.md` to document the new utility.

### 2) Why it helps
It removes a daily friction point: quickly seeing “what’s dirty / ahead / where” across all your repos without opening each folder, and keeps the workspace meta-repo’s `git status` clean.

### 3) How to use it
From the workspace root:
```bash
cd /home/koss/clawd
./scripts/clawd-projects-status
```

(Optional) Scan a different directory:
```bash
./scripts/clawd-projects-status /some/path
```

### 4) How to revert
One revert commit:
```bash
cd /home/koss/clawd
git revert 5187b4d
```

Or manual delete/undo:
```bash
cd /home/koss/clawd
git rm scripts/clawd-projects-status
git checkout -- .gitignore PROJECTS.md
git commit -m "revert: remove projects status script"
```

### 5) Next candidate friction points (up to 3)
- Add a `./scripts/clawd-projects-grep "term"` to search across all repos (fast “where is this string defined?”).
- Add a `./scripts/clawd-projects-open DIRNAME` helper to `cd` into a known project by name (with tab completion).
- Add a lightweight “preflight” script for the web projects (node version check + `npm i` + `npm run build` where available).
